context: The Finnish verb 'voittaa' means 'to win' in English. It is used to express victory over someone or something, such as winning a game, competition, battle, or overcoming an obstacle. The verb can be conjugated to different forms: 'voitan' (I win), 'voit' (you win singular informal), 'voi' (he/she/it wins), 'voimme' (we win), 'voitte' (you all/plural win), and 'ovat' (they win). In negative form, it becomes 'ei voitettu' (was not won/was defeated).
